body:
Was not present with 0.26b0 or even a git snapshot from ~2 days ago.

This triggers the new warning:
```
class SomeClass(object):
    def __init__(self, name=None):
        pass
```
But this does not:
```
class SomeClass(object):
    def __init__(self, name):
        pass
```

Full compilation (error with -Werror) from our source tree:
```
xpra/x11/bindings/posix_display_source.c: In function ‘__pyx_pw_4xpra_3x11_8bindings_20posix_display_source_17X11DisplayContext_1__init__’:
xpra/x11/bindings/posix_display_source.c:429:34: error: attribute ‘fallthrough’ not preceding a case label or default label [-Werror]
       #define CYTHON_FALLTHROUGH __attribute__((fallthrough))
                                  ^
xpra/x11/bindings/posix_display_source.c:1639:9: note: in expansion of macro ‘CYTHON_FALLTHROUGH’
         CYTHON_FALLTHROUGH;
         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
cc1: all warnings being treated as errors
```

Compiler is GCC on Fedora 26:
```
$ gcc --version
gcc (GCC) 7.1.1 20170622 (Red Hat 7.1.1-3)
Copyright (C) 2017 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
```
title: 0.26b2 new warning: attribute ‘fallthrough’ not preceding a case label or default label
